method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. Convert volumes consistently (the cm3 units cancel in the ratio). Substitute c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3, V1 = 25.0 cm3, V2 = 250.0 cm3: c2 = c1 × V1 / V2 = 0.200 × 25.0 / 250.0 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Volume increased by a factor of 10, so concentration should drop by a factor of 10 (0.200 → 0.0200).
